<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 221, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 213, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 728, 712]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 72, 136, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 791, 88]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of tanh and sech in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[422, 100, 885, 118]]<|/det|>
\[
\tanh ^{2} t+\operatorname{sech}^{2} t=1 .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 916, 116]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 382, 136, 398]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 382, 450, 398]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[296, 410, 703, 428]]<|/det|>
\[
x=\ln (\cosh t), \quad y=\tan ^{-1}(\sinh t), \quad \text { for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1 .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 442, 320, 458]]<|/det|>
Find the length of \(C\).

\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} x}{\mathrm{~d} t^{2}}+\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}-2 x=2 t^{2}+t-1,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 160, 218, 177]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t=0\), \(x=\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}=0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 609, 918, 655]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{1}{x^2 + 1}\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n\) rectangles of width \(\frac{1}{n}\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 665, 136, 681]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 665, 675, 681]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 700, 470, 740]]<|/det|>
\[
\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{n}{n^2+r^2} < \frac{1}{4} \pi .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 710, 917, 726]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 340, 917, 397]]<|/det|>
Use a similar method to find a lower bound for \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{n}{n^{2}+r^{2}}\). Give your answer in terms of \(n\) and \(\pi\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 830, 136, 846]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 820, 417, 850]]<|/det|>
Deduce the exact value of \(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{n}{n^{2}+r^{2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 830, 916, 846]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 465, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 110, 590, 143]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}-\frac{2 x+6}{x^{2}+6 x+5} y=4,
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 165, 630, 181]]<|/det|>
given that \(y=0\) when \(x=0\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 136, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 581, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) for which the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 95, 568, 156]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
\frac{3}{2} x+3 y+8 z & =1, \\
a x+3 y+4 z & =2, \\
a y-z & =3,
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 165, 410, 181]]<|/det|>
does not have a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 916, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 445, 316, 461]]<|/det|>
<pre>The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 466, 571, 524]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathbf{A}=\left(\begin{array}{rrr}
\frac{3}{2} & 3 & 8 \\
0 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 0 & -1
\end{array}\right)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 538, 136, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 538, 916, 570]]<|/det|>
